CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, National edition, November 7, 1942, pg. 17, reads: "Posey Selects 19th All-American 'Dream' Team - Here are the players Cum Posey, Courier baseball editor, selected for his All-America baseball team for 1942. This team, studded with the greats of Negro baseball, compares with the greatest in history.  Left to right: Josh Gibson, Homestead Grays, catcher; ..."Cutline for related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 17, 1943, pg. 18, reads: "Grays Change Plans; Will Drill in Homestead - Key Men in Camp as Grays and Eagles Tune up for 1943 - As the Homestead Grays launched spring drills at West Field, Homestead, Pa., and the Newark Eagles opened their limbering-up sessions in Trenton, N.J., the three experts of the diamond pictured above were being counted on heavily as key men of the respective rosters.  Josh Gibson, left, homerun king of Negro baseball, looks forward to a banner season with the Grays, champions of the Negro National league..."Negro League baseball player Josh Gibson played for the Homestead Grays 1929-1931, 1937-1940, 1942-1946; the Pittsburgh Crawfords 1932-1936; Santo Domingo 1937, and the Mexican League 1940-1941.  He was born in 1911 and died at the age of 35 in 1947.  In 1972 he was the second Negro League player to be elected into the Baseball Hall Of Fame.
TitMainTitle: Homestead Grays baseball catcher Josh Gibson standing on Forbes Field
